Name: AIX
File system supported: JFS, JFS2, ISO 9660, UDF, NFS, SMBFS, GPFS

Name: AmigaOS Classic
File system supported: Proprietary (OFS, FFS, SFS, PFS), FAT, ISO 9660, UDF, many others via 3rd party drivers, such as SMBFS, etc.

Name: AmigaOSÂ 4
File system supported: Proprietary (OFS, FFS, SFS, PFS), JXFS, FAT, ISO 9660, UDF, many others via 3rd party drivers, such as SMBFS, etc.

Name: eComStation
File system supported: HPFS (default), FAT, JFS, UDF, FAT32, NTFS (read only)

Name: FreeBSD
File system supported: UFS2, ext2, ext3, FAT, ISO 9660, UDF, NFS, ReiserFS (read only), XFS (experimental), ZFS, others

Name: GhostBSD
File system supported: UFS2, ext2, ext3, FAT, ISO 9660, UDF, NFS, ReiserFS (read only), XFS (experimental), ZFS, others

Name: Haiku
File system supported: BFS (default), FAT, ISO 9660, ext3, NTFS

Name: HP-UX
File system supported: VxFS, HFS, CDFS, EVFS, NFS, CIFS

Name: Inferno
Computer architecture supported: x86, PowerPC, SPARC, Alpha, MIPS, others
File system supported: Styx/9P2000, kfs, FAT, ISO 9660
Kernel type: Monolithic with modules, user space file systems

Name: iOS
File system supported: HFS+, FTP

Name: Linux
Computer architecture supported: x86, x86-64, ARM, PowerPC, SPARC, others
File system supported: ext2, ext3, ext4, btrfs, ReiserFS, FAT, ISO 9660, UDF, NFS, and others
Source lines of code:
~15 million (kernel)
lines of code for userland libraries and applications vary depending on the distribution

Name: Mac OS Classic
File system supported: HFS+, HFS, MFS (Mac OS 8.0 and before), AFP, ISO 9660, FAT(System 7 and later), UDF

Name: OS X
Computer architecture supported: PowerPC, x86, x86-64, (see also iOS for ARM)
File system supported: HFS+ (default), HFS, UFS, AFP, ISO 9660, FAT, UDF, NFS, SMBFS, NTFS (read only), FTP, WebDAV, ZFS (experimental)
Non-native APIs supported through subsys: Toolbox (only in versions up to Mac OS X 10.4, not supported on x86 architecture), Win16, Win32

Name: NetBSD
Computer architecture supported: x86, x86-64, ARM, MIPS, PowerPC, SPARC64, others
File system supported: UFS, UFS2, ext2, FAT, ISO 9660, NFS, LFS, and others

Name: NetWare
File system supported: NSS, NWFS, FAT, NFS, AFP, UDF, CIFS, ISO 9660
Update management: binary updates, ZENWorks for Servers, Red Carpet

Name: OpenBSD
Computer architecture supported: x86, x86-64, SPARC, 68k, Alpha, VAX, others
File system supported: ffs, ext2, FAT, ISO 9660, NFS, some others
Update management: by source or binary (packages via pkg_add)

Name: OpenVMS
File system supported: Files-11 (ODS), ISO 9660, NFS, CIFS

Name: OS/2
File system supported: HPFS, JFS, FAT, ISO 9660, UDF, NFS

Name: PC-BSD
File system supported: UFS2, ext2, ext3, FAT, ISO 9660, UDF, NFS, ReiserFS (read only), XFS (experimental) and others
Package management: Ports collection, packages, PBI Graphical Installers
Update management: by PBI updates, source, network binary update (freebsdupdate)

Name: Plan 9
Computer architecture supported: x86, Alpha, MIPS, PowerPC, SPARC, others
File system supported: fossil/venti, 9P2000, kfs, ext2, FAT, ISO 9660
Source lines of code: ~ 2.5 Million /sys/src (complete source of all supported architectures, kernels, commands and libraries)

Name: QNX
File system supported: QNX4FS, QNX6, ext2, FAT, ISO 9660, Joliet, NFS, CIFS, ETFS, UDF, HFS, HFS+, NTFS, others

Name: ReactOS
File system supported: FAT, NTFS (read only)

Name: RISC OS
File system supported: Acorn ADFS, Econet ANFS, FAT, ISO 9660, many others as loadable filesystems
Kernel type: Monolithic with modules. Cooperative multitasking with limited memory protection.
Package management: Applications self-contained; hardware drivers often in ROM
Native API: Huge number of SWI calls; extensive C libraries

Name: Solaris
File system supported: UFS, ZFS, ext2, FAT, ISO 9660, UDF, NFS, QFS, some others
Package management:
SysV packages (pkgadd)
Image Packaging System (pkg) (Solaris 11 and later)

Name: OpenSolaris
File system supported: UFS, ZFS, ext2, FAT, ISO 9660, UDF, NFS, QFS, some others

Name: STOP 6, XTS-400
File system supported: Proprietary
Update management: Binary updates via postal mail and proprietary tools

Name: Symbian
File system supported: FAT

Name: Windows Server (NT family)
File system supported: NTFS, FAT, ISO 9660, UDF; 3rd-party drivers support ext2, ext3, ReiserFS, and HFS
Non-native APIs supported through subsys: DOS API, Win16 (only in 32-bit versions), POSIX, .NET

Name: Windows (NT family)
File system supported: NTFS, FAT exFAT ISO 9660, UDF; 3rd-party drivers support ext2, ext3, ReiserFS, HFS+, FATX, and HFS (with third party driver)
Non-native APIs supported through subsys: DOS API, Win16 (only in 32-bit versions), POSIX, .NET

Name: ZETA
File system supported: BFS (default), FAT, ISO 9660, UDF, HFS, AFP, ext2, CIFS, NTFS (read only), ReiserFS (read only, up to v3.6)

Name: z/OS
File system supported: VSAM, BDAM, QSAM, BPAM, HFS, zFS, etc.
Kernel type: Protected, multithreading, multitasking nucleus with programmable/user replaceable extensions. Not kernel-based.
Native API: Filesystem access methods, Systems Services, etc.

Name: Name
File system supported: File systems supported
